meanings.definition: The stomach or intestines of an animal, especially as used for food.
meanings.sent1: The hunter cooked the thairm of the deer for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The chef used the thairm of the pig to make sausages.
meanings.sent3: The thairm of the fish was so fresh that it practically jumped into the pan.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the simmering thairm filled the kitchen with a savory scent.
meanings.sent5: The butcher carefully cleaned the thairm before preparing it for sale.

meanings.definition: A gut or string of a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The musician plucked the thairm of the guitar to create a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: The violinist carefully tuned the thairm of her instrument before the performance.
meanings.sent3: The broken thairm of the guitar made a twangy sound when touched.
meanings.sent4: The thairm of the harp resonated with a soothing hum.
meanings.sent5: The thairm of the piano vibrated with each key press, producing harmonious music.

meanings.definition: A strong, thick cord or thread.
meanings.sent1: The mountaineer secured himself with a thairm before climbing the steep cliff.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used a thairm to stitch together the heavy fabric.
meanings.sent3: The thairm of the rope held the weight of the hanging swing effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The thairm of the net was durable enough to withstand the weight of the fish.
meanings.sent5: The thairm of the hammock provided a sturdy support for relaxation in the garden.
